key_drivers: Real yields falling to 1.766% (CNBC real-time) — primary bullish driver for gold, tech, and risk assets; TIPS yield down ~9bps over 2 weeks
Crude oil deeply bearish: EIA reported +16.0MB inventory build (week ending Feb 20) with easing supply conditions; geopolitical offset from US-Iran tensions
NQ STRONG_BULLISH: SOX +1.62% session / +4.42% week, MOVE index -4.35% day / -8.23% week (rate vol collapsing), real yields falling — tech regime intact
YM and RTY corrected to SLIGHT_BEARISH: HY OAS widening (2.84 → 2.97), 2s10s curve flattening (0.64 → 0.60) — credit and curve headwinds for cyclicals and small caps
6J upgraded to BULLISH (+4): BoJ policymaker Takata called for continuing rate hikes (Feb 26), ex-BoJ Kuroda also hawkish (Feb 25) — BoJ tightening cycle intact
RBA hiked to 3.85% (Feb 3) and widening AUD-USD rate differential supporting 6A; Eurozone PMI 51.9 (14-month high) supporting M6E

fed_stance.source: CME FedWatch — 98% no-change probability at March FOMC

real_yields.value: 1.766% (CNBC US10YTIP real-time 7:39 AM EST), falling from ~1.86% on Feb 11 = -9.4bps over 2 weeks

gold_etf_flows.value: Strong inflows — AUM at all-time highs, GLD +$276M last week

credit_spreads.value: HY OAS 2.97% — Widening (from 2.84% on Feb 11, +13bps over 2 weeks)

geopolitical_risk.value: Rising — US-Iran nuclear talks, US officials warn of Iranian threat, potential military strikes

rate_diff_eur_usd.value: Stable — ECB 2.00% vs Fed 3.50-3.75%, both on hold, no change in differential direction

eurozone_growth.value: Accelerating — Composite PMI 51.9 (Feb, 14-month high), manufacturing PMI 44-month high

rba_stance.value: Hawkish — RBA hiked 25bps to 3.85% on 2026-02-03 (unanimous decision)

rate_diff_aud_usd.value: Widening — AUD 3.85% vs USD 3.50-3.75%; AUD now above Fed funds rate

china_growth.value: Stable/Mixed — Official NBS PMI 49.3 (contraction), Caixin PMI 50.3 (slight expansion)

boj_stance.value: Hawkish/Tightening — BoJ at 1.0% (Jan 2026 hike); policymaker Takata called for continuing hikes (Feb 26); ex-BoJ Kuroda also hawkish (Feb 25)

rate_diff_jpy_usd.value: Widening (JPY improving) — BoJ hiking path intact while Fed on hold; BoJ 1.0% vs Fed 3.50-3.75%, differential narrowing

stale_sources: FRED DFII10 (1 business day lag — 2026-02-24; confirmed with CNBC real-time 1.766%)
fallbacks_used: CNBC US10YTIP for real-time real yields (confirmed FRED trend)
data_quality.notes: 0730 EST report. Real yields confirmed with CNBC real-time data at 1.766% (down from 1.768% prev close). Credit spreads and yield curve corrected vs 0235 report: HY OAS is WIDENING (2.84→2.97), 2s10s is FLATTENING (0.64→0.60). BoJ stance upgraded to HAWKISH based on Feb 26 policymaker statements.
